alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:10AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington affecting all counties along the Mississippi River. .Melting snowpack in the upper Midwest will increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water affects Riverside Park in Le Claire. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday morning and continue rising to 13.1 feet Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
